channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - HP Hero
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2019 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: The top US Navy SEAL sent a blistering letter following several incidents of alleged misbehavior
item.description: The top US Navy SEAL recently sent a blistering letter to the force, writing in boldface type, "We have a problem," following several high profile incidents of alleged misbehavior by the US Navy's elite service members, CNN has learned.

item.title: US Navy SEAL team ordered home from ISIS fight for drinking alcohol while deployed
item.description: The US military is taking the rare step of sending home an elite team of Navy SEALs from Iraq due to "a perceived deterioration of good order and discipline" that caused a military commander to lose "confidence in the team's ability to accomplish the mission."

item.title: SEAL team redeployed home over alleged misbehavior
item.description: The US military is taking the rare step of sending home an elite team of Navy SEALs from Iraq due to "a perceived deterioration of good order and discipline" that caused a military commander to lose "confidence in the team's ability to accomplish the mission." CNN's Barbara Starr reports.

item.title: Navy SEAL Eddie Gallagher sentenced to reduction in rank
item.description: Navy SEAL team leader Eddie Gallagher will be demoted in rank and his pay will be reduced for posing for a photo with a dead ISIS prisoner, a jury decided Wednesday.

item.title: Trump moves to rescind Gallagher prosecutors' medals
item.description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday ordered top Navy officials to rescind medals awarded to the prosecutors who unsuccessfully tried Navy SEAL team leader Eddie Gallagher for murder.

item.title: Suicides in US special operations units tripled in 2018
item.description: Suicides among active duty military personnel assigned to US Special Operations Command tripled in 2018, in a disturbing and as yet unexplained spike, CNN has learned.

item.title: Trump presents the Medal of Honor to Navy SEAL
item.description: President Donald Trump on Thursday presented the Medal of Honor to Master Chief Special Warfare Operator Britt Slabinski, recalling the Navy SEAL's heroism in a 2002 combat mission during Operation Enduring Freedom in Afghanistan when his teammate was thrown out of a helicopter.

item.title: When did Obama become a Republican?
item.description: When did Barack Obama become a Republican?

item.title: Obama allies exasperated as Democrats put his legacy on trial
item.description: He's the most popular figure in the Democratic Party by far, revered by liberals, moderates and even some Republicans.

item.title: Trump: Don't know if I can stop chant
item.description: President Donald Trump says he doesn't know if his supporters will yell "send her back", a chant aimed at Rep. Ilhan Omar (D-MN), at his campaign rally in Ohio but says he "prefers that they don't."

item.title: Trump pledges new China tariffs that would hit consumer goods
item.description: President Donald Trump tweeted Thursday that he will add a new tariff on $300 billion of Chinese-made products on September 1, which would effectively put a tax on all Chinese goods coming into the United States.

item.title: Trump offers Putin help fighting wildfires
item.description: US President Donald Trump offered Russian President Vladimir Putin assistance in fighting vast wildfires in Siberia during a phone call on Wednesday, the Kremlin said in a statement.

item.title: Winners and losers of Night 2 of CNN's debates
item.description: • Analysis: How you know Gabbard really got under Harris' skin • 5 takeaways from the Democratic debate • Debate coach: These are the surprise winners of the debate

item.title: Lindsey Graham's move slammed as 'unprecedented'
item.description: The Senate Judiciary Committee passed Chairman Lindsey Graham's asylum legislation along party lines in a contentious meeting.

item.title: Analysis: How you know Gabbard really got under Harris' skin
item.description: In Wednesday night's Democratic presidential debate in Detroit, Tulsi Gabbard decided to drop her opposition research book right on Kamala Harris.

item.title: Dems vow to derail Ratcliffe nomination
item.description: Democrats are ratcheting up their vows to stop Rep. John Ratcliffe from being confirmed as the next director of national intelligence amid questions about whether the Texas Republican exaggerated his resume as a federal prosecutor working on terrorism cases.

item.title: Trump rallying in Cincinnati hoping to capitalize on Democratic debates
item.description: President Donald Trump on Thursday seeks to get the last word on his would-be competition after two nights of Democrats facing off on the debate stage.

item.title: Lowe's is laying off thousands of workers
item.description: Lowe's is laying off thousands of workers.

item.title: Intel indicates al Qaeda leader has potentially serious heart complaint, official says
item.description: Recent intelligence indicates that al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri has a "heart complaint," according to a senior official involved in international counterterrorism efforts.

item.title: Second rocket launcher found at Baltimore airport
item.description: Finding one rocket launcher in someone's luggage is unusual for security officials, but two in one week is unheard-of.

item.title: US Navy pilot killed in crash in Death Valley National Park
item.description: The US Navy confirmed Thursday that the pilot of the F/A-18E Super Hornet that crashed Wednesday in Death Valley National Park died as a result of the crash.

item.title: Pentagon to test new missile as US pulls out of nuclear treaty
item.description: The US military is set to test a new non-nuclear mobile-launched cruise missile developed specifically to challenge Russia in Europe, according to a senior US defense official.

item.title: Body of Instagram star found in suitcase
item.description: Police in Russia said they have arrested a suspect after Russian social media influencer Yekaterina Semochkina's body was found in a suitcase inside a Moscow apartment.

item.title: Man held in case of missing brothers after human remains are found on his farm
item.description: A man being investigated in connection with two missing Wisconsin farmers will remain in jail without bond until another hearing next week, a Missouri judge ruled Thursday, according to CNN affiliate KCTV.

item.title: Report: Missing mom's bloody T-shirt found in trash
item.description: The shirt that police believe Jennifer Farber Dulos was wearing the day she disappeared more two months ago was found stained with blood in a trash can, The Hartford Courant reported Wednesday.

item.title: Reagan used racist slur on newly released tape. Historian tells why it's troubling
item.description: In a newly unearthed audio clip, then-California Gov. Ronald Reagan disparaged "monkeys" from African countries in a phone call with then-President Richard Nixon, according to the former director of Nixon's presidential library.

item.title: Move over TSA PreCheck. Long live Clear!
item.description: Boarding a flight to Miami out of JFK Terminal 2 in New York City earlier this year, I knew I had pushed it a bit too far.

item.title: Country band Confederate Railroad says it won't change its name
item.description: Confederate Railroad has lost out on two gigs over its name and logo, but the country rock band is moving full steam ahead.

item.title: Olympic figure skater Ashley Wagner says she was sexually assaulted when she was 17
item.description: Ashley Wagner has chosen to speak up.

item.title: Why Jeff Bezos sold $1.8 billion of Amazon stock
item.description: Jeff Bezos has sold more than $1.8 billion worth of stock, as the world's richest person continues to sell his Amazon stake to fund his space venture.

item.title: Flight attendant's odd move surprises passengers
item.description: A flight attendant on a Southwest Airlines flight welcomed passengers onboard from the comfort of the overhead bin.

item.title: Edward Snowden writes book to explain 'his mindset' in leaking government docs
item.description: Edward Snowden, the former National Security Agency contractor who leaked a trove of classified documents about a US government program of mass surveillance in 2013, is sharing his story with the world in a new memoir.

item.title: Co-stars and friends remember Patrick Swayze in new documentary
item.description: The many shades of Patrick Swayze are revealed through interviews with his friends and co-stars in the upcoming documentary "I Am Patrick Swayze."

item.title: Massachusetts towns at 'high risk' for mosquito-borne virus
item.description: Health officials are warning that seven towns in southeastern Massachusetts are at "high risk" for a potentially fatal mosquito-borne virus known as Eastern equine encephalitis or EEE.

item.title: Miami Dolphins legend dies
item.description: NFL Hall of Fame football player Nick Buoniconti, who won a championship with the undefeated Miami Dolphins in 1972, has died at 78.

item.title: An asteroid bigger than the Empire State Building is passing by Earth next week. Here's why you shouldn't be worried
item.description: Yes, there's an asteroid bigger than the Empire State building passing by Earth. No, it's not anything to worry about -- it's actually pretty normal.

item.title: Ancient star sheds light on Big Bang mystery
item.description: On the other side of the Milky Way galaxy, astronomers have discovered an ancient star that contains evidence of the very first stars formed after the Big Bang.

item.title: This sizzling exoplanet is turning into a football
item.description: Sizzling exoplanets have been found before, but WASP-121b continues to surprise astronomers. In 2017, they discovered a water vapor atmosphere that glowed because it was so hot.

item.title: Potentially habitable super-Earth discovered 31 light-years away
item.description: After completing its first year of observations in the southern sky, NASA's Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite has spotted some intriguing new exoplanets only 31 light-years away from Earth.

item.title: Doctors find 526 teeth in boy's mouth in India
item.description: A 7-year-old boy complaining of jaw pain was found to have 526 teeth inside his mouth, according to the hospital in India where he was treated.

item.title: Woman turns 107 and shares secret to longevity
item.description: A woman who celebrated her 107th birthday on Wednesday shared her secret to living a long life: stay single.

item.title: Man invents a new surgery and cures himself
item.description: Doug Lindsay was bedridden for 11 years with a rare condition that didn't have a surgical fix - until he decided to invent the surgery himself.

item.title: What happens during an autopsy?
item.description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta explains who performs an autopsy and how it is conducted.

item.title: Forgotten Nintendo game sells for $9k after 30 years in attic
item.description: Scott Amos says his mom's been after him to get his childhood junk out of her Reno, Nevada, attic since he moved out on his own more than 20 years ago, and now, his whole family's glad he did.

item.title: Universal Orlando announces new Epic Universe theme park
item.description: There's a new theme park coming soon to Florida, and this one promises to be epic.

item.title: CNN panel roasts Booker over Kool-Aid debate moment
item.description: CNN panelists cracked up over former Vice President Joe Biden and Sen. Cory Booker's (D-NJ) exchange over criminal justice records during the second night of the CNN Democratic primary debate.

item.title: An evasive emu is on the loose in North Carolina
item.description: The skittish bird looks like a creature out of prehistoric times, but it's popping up now in people's front yards in central North Carolina.

item.title: Tariff Man is back. US consumers will pay for it
item.description: The Tariff Man is back. President Donald Trump's newly proposed tariffs on China would be particularly bad news for US consumers.

item.title: Coke and Pepsi abandon the plastics lobby
item.description: Coca-Cola and PepsiCo, two major sellers of plastic bottles, have made sweeping sustainability commitments. Now they are stepping away from a plastics lobbying group.

item.title: Americans are buying more expensive trucks. That's great news for GM
item.description: The US economy is strong, and Americans are splurging on their trucks. That's great news for General Motors, which reported strong second-quarter earnings Thursday, boosted by higher pickup truck prices.

item.title: Who really won the Democratic debate?
Cory Booker's secret weapon
item.description: Cory Booker had it on Wednesday. Kamala Harris didn't. Elizabeth Warren flashed it on Tuesday. Bernie Sanders didn't. The "it" we're referring to wasn't quick-witted responses or even a clear articulation of their stance on the issues. The secret weapon that helped separate the winners from the losers was nothing more than a smile.

item.title: Herman Melville is 200, but 'Moby-Dick' is very 2019
item.description: Along with so many, I was first subjected to "Moby-Dick" when I was still a teenager, being forced to read it as part of an American literature survey course. I was not a fan of it-- I certainly could never have anticipated I would one day make a film about it. I thought it was a laborious read. Its narrative was glacially slow, and the titular antagonist doesn't even make an appearance until the final pages of the novel. I resented the book and was quite glad to put it down and (hopefully) never touch it again.

item.title: The reality show that is changing the game for LGBTQ fans
item.description: Television helped me grow up. Now I'm watching TV grow.

item.title: Reagan's racist call isn't a surprise
item.description: The release by the National Archives of a racist telephone conversation between President Richard Nixon and future President Ronald Reagan (then-governor of California) casts a strobe light on an uncomfortable fact: One of our most popular Presidents was far from the only commander-in-chief to display racial bigotry.

item.title: Bin Laden heir dead: A blow to al-Qaeda?
item.description: A US official confirmed to CNN that Hamza bin Laden, Osama bin Laden's son, is believed dead and that the United States had a role in his death.

item.title: Save up to 50% - Summer Deals in Myrtle Beach
Refinance rates at 3.018% APR. Do you qualify?
8 cards charging 0% interest until 2021
Bill Nye's experimental spacecraft that sails on sunlight declares mission success
item.description: About 450 miles above Earth, a small satellite is drifting deeper into the cosmos — powered not by rocket fuel, thrusters or other contraptions. This satellite, called LightSail 2, is sailing on a sunbeam.

item.title: This Apollo 11 experiment is still happening on the moon
item.description: When astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin walked on the surface of the moon 50 years ago, they took photos, collected lunar rock samples and left behind an experiment that's still sending back data.

item.title: Answers to your weirdest space-travel questions
item.description: People have a lot of questions (and misconceptions) about space.

item.title: Fireball spotted in the skies could have dropped meteorites
item.description: A fireball bright enough to rival the moon lit up the skies over southern Ontario and Quebec early Wednesday morning at 2:44 a.m. ET. All ten cameras in Western University's All-Sky Camera Network, which collaborates with NASA's Meteoroid Environment Office, captured the view.

item.title: SpaceX launches Nickelodeon slime
item.description: A SpaceX Dragon capsule vaulted into orbit Thursday carrying an eclectic batch of supplies destined for the International Space Station.

item.title: Hong Kong protests: Head of China's military garrison condemns violence
item.description: The commander of the Chinese military garrison in Hong Kong has addressed the city's ongoing protest movement for the first time, warning that violence by pro-democracy groups "should not be tolerated."

item.title: Thousands are trapped in a desert settlement in Syria, a US military base is just 10 miles away
item.description: Shukri Shehab and his wife have not slept in two nights. Their three-week-old granddaughter will not stop crying. She needs simple medicine for bloating, Shehab says, but it is nearly impossible for them to find.

item.title: Video shows boy after 500 teeth removed from his mouth
item.description: A 7-year-old boy complaining of jaw pain was found to have an extra 526 teeth inside his mouth, according to the hospital in India where he was treated.

item.title: London Stock Exchange buys data provider Refinitiv in $27 billion deal
item.description: The London Stock Exchange has agreed to buy financial data provider Refinitiv, creating a British rival to industry juggernaut Bloomberg.

item.title: Asian carp shocked into leaping from water
item.description: Asian carp are a serious problem, and Kentucky is getting creative in dealing with the invasive species.
